metadata.title: CVE-2016-4955 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
ntpd in NTP 4.x before 4.2.8p8, when autokey is enabled, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (peer-variable clearing andassociation outage) by sending (1) a spoofed crypto-NAK packet or (2) apacket with an incorrect MAC value at a certain time.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4955` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3').
